qas.question: Why was Albert the heir presumptive to the throne?

answers.text: Edward was unmarried and had no children

qas.question: What was wrong with Edward marrying Wallis Simpson?

answers.text: divorced woman with two living ex-husbands

qas.question: What did Edward do to marry Wallis Simpson?
How did Edward react when he became heir to the throne?

answers.text: broke down and sobbed like a child

qas.question: Who was Wallis Simpson's second husband?
How many children did Albert have in 1936?
On what date did Albert become king?
On what date was Edward made the king of England?
Who did Edward replaces as the King of England?

context: As <a0_0>Edward was unmarried and had <b6_0>no children<b6_0/><a0_0/>, <b5_0>Albert<b5_0/> was the heir presumptive to the throne. Less than a year later, on <b7_0><b8_0>11 December 1936<b8_0/><b7_0/>, Edward VIII abdicated in order to marry his mistress, Wallis Simpson, who was divorced from her first husband and divorcing her second. Edward had been advised by British Prime Minister Stanley Baldwin that he could not remain king and marry a <a1_0>divorced woman with two living ex-husbands<a1_0/>. Edward chose <a2_0>abdication<a2_0/> in preference to abandoning his marriage plans. Thus Albert became king, a position he was reluctant to accept. The day before the abdication, he went to London to see his mother, <a3_0><b9_0>Queen Mary<b9_0/><a3_0/>. He wrote in his diary, "When I told her what had happened, I <a4_0>broke down and sobbed like a child<a4_0/>."
